channel.title: iPod Nano
channel.description: Hey guys, I got an iPod nano before, but for some reason it won't turn on, respond when I plug it into the computer, or anything, does anyone know the fix? I've googled and couldn't find anything.

item.title: iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

I used a Mac when I spent a few weeks at SAA(School of Advertising Art). That’s why I said it’s pretty much used for training, I’ve never really seen somebody just use it for personal use.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:24, topic:165182”]Don’t got all Apple fanyboy on me again D:
The only thing I’ve ever seen a Mac computer used for is a small business, training, and schooling. It isn’t something you go boot up and play a game or like… program at all on.[/quote]

Mac’s have been primarily used for graphics, and I’m surprised you don’t know. Coupled with the fact that most popular games are Mac compatible.

[quote=“God of Ikiliki, post:25, topic:165182”]Fail
The name ‘apple’ says it already.

Just buy a mobile phone and use the MP3 on it, otherwise go with a normal mp3, apple’s things are waste of money.[/quote]

iPods are considerably better than phone MP3 players.

[quote=“exe626, post:27, topic:165182”]Here’s my reason to not like Apple products:
Over-priced. You can get the same thing out of a pc with less cost.
‘Look’ isn’t everything. They seem to think this.
I see these commercials with dimwitted people saying how much they prefer it over a pc. I wish they would stfu.[/quote]

As I’ve shown you the last time we debated, Apple products are not more expensive than PC’s. All other ideas are speculation.

Looks are hardly the extent to which Mac’s are better than PC’s. A fine attention to detail and ease of doing mundane tasks are multiple reasons as to why Mac’s are better. Case-in-point: iScroll2.

And I’d love to hear your personal experience with Mac’s.

Read full topic

item.description:

That’s not reasons why they are bad. It just says there are cheaper alternatives.

item.title: iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

Same thing happened to mine.

Here what I did:
When I plugged it in, I installed a driver, because my comp was gay and didn’t the right driver or was outdated.

Then, I tried plugging it in on another comp and then restored it.

And it worked. Hope I helped.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod Nano
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:16, topic:165182”][quote author=God of Ikiliki link=topic=224163.msg1936425#msg1936425 date=1197912942]
Does it matter how it looks like?
It’s in your trouser pocket or wherever you have it all the time lol
[/quote]
Well aside from its ugliness i find it annoying not being able to quickly scroll through songs and being provided with their titles on the screen.

With the shuffle you have to just keep clicking next…
Unless there’s some new version with a screen that i am unaware of.[/quote]
I don’t care, I’ll put it on song and leave it on it. Mainly it’s just to stop the shit I get in class.

Read full topic
